availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Warren Viley (Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer, horse breeder, and turfman)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer, horse breeder, and turfman. Scott County, Kentucky native. Son of Willa Viley and Lydia Smith Viley. Married to Catherine Jane Martin Viley. Father of George W. Viley, John W. Viley, Ann E. Viley, Martha J. Viley, Breckinridge Viley, and May Viley. Farmer in Woodford County in 1850. Horse breeder and turfman in Woodford County.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District No. 1, p. 442B. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Versailles Township, p. 58. "Maj. Viley. Famous Kentucky Turfman Dies at Midway, *Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), January 20, 1902, p. 2. Find A Grave, "Warren Viley (1817-1902)," Memorial #98984057, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/98984057/warren-viley (accessed January 16, 2018).
